title: Installation issues with PyTorch on Windows
body_html:
Here are some of my notes on installation experience with PyTorch on WIndows. For most part it works fine. However if you have Visual Studio 2017 update installed with new experimental Python debugger, you might get following error on import torch coming from init.py, torch._C import:

ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified procedure could not be found.

After bunch of trying various things, I finally ended up uninstalling and re-installing Anaconda. However, for Anaconda 4.2 (which is last version with Python 3.5 as default) you get following error:

C:\WINDOWS\system32>conda install pytorch -c pytorch
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .
PackageNotFoundError: Package not found: '' Dependency missing in current win-64 channels:
  - pytorch -> mkl >=2018

However running the Anaconda upgrade makes this issue go away:

conda update conda
conda update anaconda

The end conclusion is that make sure to have Anaconda 4.5.2 or higher and if you get dreaded import error like above due to Visual Studio update then save time by just re-installing Anaconda.

body:
Here are some of my notes on installation experience with PyTorch on WIndows. For most part it works fine. However if you have Visual Studio 2017 update installed with new experimental Python debugger, you might get following error on `import torch` coming from _init_.py, torch._C import:

```
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified procedure could not be found.
```

After bunch of trying various things, I finally ended up uninstalling and re-installing Anaconda. However, for Anaconda 4.2 (which is last version with Python 3.5 as default) you get following error:

```
C:\WINDOWS\system32>conda install pytorch -c pytorch
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .
PackageNotFoundError: Package not found: '' Dependency missing in current win-64 channels:
  - pytorch -> mkl >=2018
```

However running the Anaconda upgrade makes this issue go away:

```
conda update conda
conda update anaconda
```

The end conclusion is that make sure to have Anaconda 4.5.2 or higher and if you get dreaded import error like above due to Visual Studio update then save time by just re-installing Anaconda.
